title: British Airways Celebrates 10 Years Of Flying To BengaluruTravelandtourworld.com
text:
British Airways Celebrates 10 Years Of Flying To Bengaluru
This October celebrate with us, at British Airways, as we complete a decade long journey flying to the garden city with a true cultural streak; Bengaluru.
On 30 October 2005, our Boeing 777 took to the skies connecting London with Bengaluru with a five flights per week service. Today, after 10 years of flying to the city, we operate daily flights between London and Bengaluru, offering three class configuration namely, Club World (Business), World Traveller Plus (Premium Economy) and World Traveller (Economy) to our customers.
To mark the landmark achievement in India, we are pleased to announce special celebratory fares to the UK starting from just INR 48,115 . With these exciting offers various UK destinations are now only a click away! The offer is now live, valid for booking until 31 October 2015 and for outbound travel until 31 March 2016 .
We, at British Airways, always keep our customers at the heart of our business, and endeavour to exceed our customers’ expectations throughout their journey with us. We have recently launched our A380 on the San Francisco route and our flights from Bangalore provide seamless connections through our hub at Heathrow Terminal 5, to customers travelling to San Jose and San Fransisco. The convenient travel option from Bengaluru helps customers arrive refreshed at work or to relax at their destination giving them additional time to spend with their family and friends.
Moran Birger, British Airways’ Regional Commercial Manager, South Asia said, “This October, we create another milestone in our history with India as we, at British Airways, complete 10 years of flying to Bengaluru. There is so much more to the UK than what is currently known to globetrotters around the world. We invite our customers to take advantage of the special offers to some of the most exciting UK destinations such as London and Manchester and be a part of this festivity.”
“Bengaluru is a growing market for us, both for business and leisure travel and we hope to provide our customers across India excellent value for money with an unparalleled service. It is truly a time to celebrate, come join the celebration.”
In 2014, we further expanded in India, with added focus in South India. We launched Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft to Chennai (October 2014 along with the increase in flights from a six to a daily operation) and to Hyderabad (March 2014).
Customers can experience our exceptional quality and impeccable service in our Club World cabins, World Traveller Plus and World Traveller. With over 90 years of flying to India, we at British Airways, are proud of our legacy, heritage and growth in the Indian market.
Source:- British Airways
